Title: EWM MFS Consultant
Description:
Descripci√≥n de la oferta de empleo					



						EWM MFS Consultant  
Job Type: Contract role 6+ Months ‚Äì Inside Ir35  
Job Location: London, UK  
Client: Wipro  
 
EWM Consultant for EWM Implementation Project  
 
We are seeking an experienced EWM Consultant to join our team for an EWM implementation project. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) with a proven track record of successfully delivering at least two end-to-end EWM implementation projects. The consultant should have in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in various EWM functionalities, including Inbound, Outbound, Production Integration, and Physical Inventory processes.  
 
Responsibilities:  
1. EWM Implementation: Lead and actively participate in all phases of EWM implementation projects, including requirement gathering, solution design, system configuration, testing, training, and go-live support.  
2. Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate them into functional and technical specifications for EWM system implementation.  
3. Solution Design: Design and configure EWM system to meet the specific business requirements including layouts, put-away and removal strategies, ECC integration with S/4 HANA, business process mapping and ensuring optimal utilization of EWM functionalities and integration with external systems. Experience of RF integration framework, development/enhancements of RF screens.  
4. Inbound Process: Configure and optimize inbound processes such as goods receipt, put away, quality management, and returns, ensuring seamless integration with procurement and production processes.  
5. Outbound Process: Design and implement outbound processes including order fulfilment, picking, packing, staging, and shipping, considering various order types, delivery scenarios, and transportation management integration.  
6. Production Integration: Collaborate with the production team to integrate EWM with the manufacturing processes, ensuring smooth flow of materials, inventory management, and accurate tracking within the production environment.  
7. Physical Inventory: Define and implement physical inventory procedures, including cycle counting, inventory reconciliation, stocktaking, and variance analysis to ensure inventory accuracy and compliance.  
8. Documentation and Training: Prepare system documentation, process flowcharts, and user manuals. Conduct end-user training sessions to ensure smooth adoption and effective utilization of the EWM system.  
9. Testing and Issue Resolution: Plan and execute comprehensive testing activities, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing. Identify and resolve system issues, defects, or configuration gaps during the testing phase.  
10. Communication and Collaboration: Demonstrate excellent communication skills to effectively interact with clients, project team members, and stakeholders. Foster collaborative relationships and provide expert guidance to project teams throughout the implementation lifecycle.  
 
Requirements:  
1. Minimum of 8 years of experience as an EWM Consultant, with a focus on EWM implementation projects.  
2. Proven experience in delivering at least two end-to-end EWM implementation projects.  
3. Strong knowledge of EWM functionalities, including Inbound, Outbound, Production Integration, and Physical Inventory processes.  
4. Hands-on experience in configuring EWM system, including master data setup, warehouse process types, strategies, and rules.  
5. Excellent understanding of integration points between EWM and other SAP modules, such as SAP MM, SD, PP, and TM.  
6. Proficient in EWM documentation practices and ability to create functional and technical specifications, process flowcharts, and user manuals.  
7. Solid experience in conducting system testing, issue resolution, and providing post-go-live support.  
8. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  
9. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to analyse business processes, identify areas for improvement, and propose innovative solutions.  
10. Proactive attitude, self-motivated, and ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.  
 
If you are a dedicated EWM professional with a proven track record in successful implementations, possessing excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and seeking an exciting opportunity to work on challenging EWM projects, we would love to hear from you.

						As a KYC Backend Spark Developer Tribe Technical Lead, your mission will be to develop, test and deploy the technical and functional specifications from the Solution Designers / Business Architects / Business Analysts, guaranteeing the correct operability and compliance with the internal quality levels.

- You will coordinate the Technical Product Teams¬¥ efforts. This role ensures that the overall technical strategy is applied across the different parts of the product and helps reduce dependencies between them. It has a close relationship with all product owners and stakeholders.
 
We need someone like you to help us in different fronts:
 
- Ensure Technical end-to-end accountability for your product.

- Define / Support / Implement technical product strategy in alignment with Santander business objectives.

- Continuous integration/DevOps paradigm and toolset (Git, GitHub, Jenkins, Sonar, Nexus, Jira).
- Experience with different database structures, including Postgres, SQL, Hive.

Preferred qualifications:
 
- DDBBs (MongoDB‚Ä¶)
